Package multicast.protocol

Class MulticastPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • multicast.protocol.MulticastPacket
  • public class MulticastPacket
extends java.lang.Object
    The MulticastPacket class is a class that works like a wrapper arrowing the DatagramPacket implementation. Since the DatagramPacket cannot be extended (because it has been marked as a final class) this class aims to provide the same features but adapted to work with the MulticastProtocol developed for our application.

    The data contained in a MulticastPacket follows a hashmap like structure and is parsed and stored using that data structure. The string representation of a packet before it is parsed is the following 

     {source = VotingDesk@DEI ; target = VT-1 ; status="logged-in"}

    This API provides methods that make easy the sending and receiving of messages between 2 multicast entities Usage examples are shown bellow: MulticastPacket empty = new MulticastPacket(); empty.put("Hello", "World"); String query = empty.get("Hello") MulticastPacket packet = new MulticastPacket.from(socket) System.out.println(packet); Multicast info = new MulticastPacket() info.add("username", "pedro"); info.sendTo(socket, group, port); // Example using MulticastProtocol protocol standard. MulticastPacket ack = MulticastProtocol.acknowledge(); ack.sendTo(socket, group, port);

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pedro Rodrigues, Miguel Rabuge
    See Also:
    DatagramPacket, InetAddress

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static MulticastPacket from​(java.net.MulticastSocket socket,
                                   java.lang.String self)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        This static method provides a simple way to read a datagram from a socket and parse it returning a multicast packet with all the information that was contained in that packet. The method assumes in its implementation that any message that has origin in the sender of the current message is to be ignored. We take that in consideration because being the message sent to a multicast group there is a risk of the sender reading a message that was sent by itself. For that not to happen we use a loop that only breaks when a message that does not have a source in self is received
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket where the message is to be read.
        self - The ID of the sender of this message.
        Returns:
        The MulticastPacket with all the information contained in the datagram received from the socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - A exception thrown if the socket where we were trying to read is closed during the read operation

      • parse

        public static MulticastPacket parse​(java.net.DatagramPacket datagramPacket)
        This static method implements the parsing needed to transform the textual information contained in a DatagramPacket into a MulticastPacket.
        Parameters:
        datagramPacket - The DatagramPacket that is going to be parsed
        Returns:
        The MulticastPacket that was parsed from the original message conveyed in the DatagramPacket

      • sendTo

        public void sendTo​(java.net.MulticastSocket socket,
                   java.net.InetAddress address,
                   int port)
            throws java.io.IOException
        A method that is used to send a the information contained in this instance of the MulticastPacket to the given socket linked to a given multicast group address and port.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket where the information will be sent
        address - The address of the group where that information will go to
        port - The port to be used to send the messages.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - A exception thrown if the socket where we were trying to read is closed during the read operation

      • put

        public void put​(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String value)
        A setter method for the underlying hashmap used to store this packet information.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the hashmap
        value - The value to be associated with a given key

      • get

        public java.lang.String get​(java.lang.String key)
        A getter method for retrieving the value associated with a key of the hashmap used has a storage data structure of the packet implementation.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the item to be fetched
        Returns:
        The value associated with the given key

      • getItems

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getItems()
        This method retrieves the reference to the hashmap used in the underlying implementation of this hashmap
        Returns:
        The hashmap data structure containing all the items of this packet

      • getPacketBytes

        private byte[] getPacketBytes()
        This method transforms the information of the hashmap that contains the information of this MulticastPacket to bytes in order for this packet to be sent as a datagram.
        Returns:
        The byte representation of the items of this MulticastPacket
